block.p: 1. The clothes are school uniforms that the students are volunteered to wear. According to advocates of the move, discipline problems have been reduced since the dress code was adopted.
2. The two nations failed to conclude major new accords on such key issues dividing them as Soviet withdrawal from Afghanistan and United States testing of space-based defensive weapons.
3. The money raised through the sale of the Coliseum property is being spent as part of the operating budget for the fiscal year 1988, which began July 1.

4. Warsaw announced that steep price increases planned for next year for basic foods will instead be put into effect over three years. The Government linked the action to the failure of a referendum seeking popular support for the increases. Sharp increases in the prices of rents, heat and fuel will not be scaled back.
5. To permit better scheduling of crews. According to male officers, the policy of single-sex crews causes men to carry an unequal share of duty.
6. His name and works will be marketed by the company whose marketing was responsible for the success of the Cabbage Patch dolls.
7. Many of the patients are showing little if any improvement and are typically far sicker than had been expected.
8. That dioxin's potency in inducing cancer is one-sixteenth that of an estimate by the agency two years ago.
9. In a game against the Boston Bruins, Hextell became the first goalie to score by shooting the puck into the opponent's net.
10. An author's right to use the names of living people in works of fiction.
11. New observations by radiotelescopes support the theory that stars are formed from collapsing gas clouds, and indicate that the process is spawning dozens of stars at once.
12. A position paper by the nation's Roman Catholic bishops that offered qualified support for teaching about condoms in Catholic school educational programs aimed at fighting the spread of AIDS.
13. The European Community's transport ministers approved an airline deregulation package that is expected to lower air fares within Europe by next summer.
14. Judge Kennedy received the American Bar Asssociation's highest rating by unanimous vote.
15. There are 300 blue, green, red and amber lights in the room's dome that flicker or fade as music is played.
16. He is Tim Brown, winner of the Heisman Trophy. Don McPherson, the quarterback who led Syracuse to its first undefeated regular season in 28 years, finished No. 2.
